description: Advertisement consent for the erection of two illuminated advertisements attached to the construction hoardings fronting Wandsworth Road and Nine Elms Lane for a temporary period of five years during the redevelopment of the Northern Site Development Zone of the New Covent Garden Market site.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The proposed signage should operate at an illumination level no greater than 600cd/m2 between. 
To ensure the sign does not have an adverse effect on the amenity of the area in accordance with Council policy DMS8 and to accord with the guidance set out in the Institute of Lighting Professionals (ILP) publication: "The Brightness of Illuminated Advertisements" (PLG05, January 2015).

Condition : 2 - The proposed signage must not have any intermittent light source, moving feature, animation or exposed cold cathode tubing.
In the interest of highway safety and of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with Council policy DMS8
Condition : 3 - The advertisement under this consent shall not be displayed after the date 5 years from the date of this consent unless a further express consent for the display of such an advertisement is obtained from the Local Planning Authority.
The surrounding area is undergoing significant regeneration and display beyond the 5 years is likely to be inappropriate in terms of visual amenity, in accordance with Council policy DMS8 and the Town and Country Planning (Advertisement) Regulations 2007.


Condition : 4 - The footway and carriageway of the Nine Elms Lane and Wandsworth Road must not be blocked during installation of the signage. Temporary obstructions during installation must be kept to a minimum and should not encroach on the clear space needed to provide safe passage to pedestrians or obstruct the flow of traffic on   Nine Elms Lane and Wandsworth Road. All vehicles associated with the installation of the signage must only park/ stop at permitted locations and within the time periods permitted by existing on street restrictions.  No skips or construction materials shall be kept on the footway or carriageway of the TLRN at any point
In the interest of highway safety in accordance with Council policy DMS8

Condition : 5 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and specifications, unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority.
"	N8 Entrance Lettering (7 January 2021, prepared by City & County Graphics); 
"	LED Canopy Fascia and Wall Wash Fixture specification document (prepared by Sloan LED); 
"	One Thames City Nine Elms - Hoarding Design and Planning Pack (11 February 2020, prepared by Pollitt & Partners)
"	LED Flexible Strips Spec Sheet
"	PUC-V06 Series Data Sheet (Rev B); 
"	Talex Converter LCU IP67 Data Sheet and 
"	Transformer Layout (VS).
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development, and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
site_name: Development Site Of Nine Elms Square Former Flower Market
